newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: DUTCH CAP GEMINI 96 PROFIT JUMPS 25 PCT.
newsitem.headline: DUTCH CAP GEMINI 96 PROFIT JUMPS 25 PCT.

text.p: Software firm Cap Gemini NV said on Thursday 1996 net profits jumped 25.3 percent to 90.2 million guilders on the back of healthy sales growth across all its divisions.
The company, 58 percent-owned by France's Cap Gemini SA said it expected further market growth in 1997, but that it was too early to give a firm forecast of full-year earnings.
It said it would hike its 1996 dividend to 1.75 guilders per share, a rise of 30 percent on the 1.35 guilders of 1995.
Net profit margins rose to 9.1 percent in 1996 from 8.5 percent in 1995.
"This is the highest profit margin among Dutch software firms," co-chairman Berend Brix told a results news conference.
Brix said Cap Gemini's net margins were some 30 to 50 percent higher than the overall market.
"We cannot improve our net profit margin relative to the overall market as it is already extremely high," he said.
"If the market declines, so will our margins, but if the market shows a healthy increase we will also benefit," he said.
Cap Gemini said it was keen to boost turnover from Information System Management, which currently accounts for some 6.2 percent of group turnover, to around 20 percent.
It said it expected no major sales boost from computer systems updates to cope with the millennium and the advent of a single European currency, despite some upbeat remarks from competitors earlier.
Dutch electronics firm Getronics said last week systems and programme updates would generate some 10 billion guilders in additional turnover on the Dutch market.
Getronics said then it expected to capture around five percent of the market growth.
But Cap Gemini's Brix said he did not believe the market would grow as a result.
"Our clients are making the changes to their systems themselves or reducing other information technology spending so as not to increase their budget," he said.
Cap Gemini shares rose 2.20 guilders to 70.00 at 1300 GMT on Thursday after briefly touching a high of 70.40 earlier. REUTER/WGB lvl
